channel.title: JProgressBars, Can you make them load nothing?
channel.description: I have been experimenting with ProgressBars, I really have nothing for them to load, So is it possible to use time delays and just make it load slow?

item.title: JProgressBars, Can you make them load nothing?
item.dc:creator: @sparkz sparkz
item.description:
@sparkz wrote:

l2java

google constructors
class myclass = new class(args);
myclass.methodname();

1 main method, not 1 per class.

Read full topic
item.source: JProgressBars, Can you make them load nothing?

item.title: JProgressBars, Can you make them load nothing?
item.dc:creator: @Yz85Racer Yz85Racer
item.description:
@Yz85Racer wrote:

[quote=“lawl, post:1, topic:121284”][quote author= Java  link=topic=170338.msg1580953#msg1580953 date=1183965515]
yes there in the same directory… actually, what im trying to do is, i have a menubar on my client, now one option is map, and when i click it i want another GUI to appear, so i made another class to hold that GUI, and the GUI is in its main method, so i made it call the main method but…

Frame_Sub1.java:37: main(java.lang.String[]) in mapframe cannot be applied to ()

             mapframe.main();
                     ^
Note: Some input files use or override a deprecated API.
Note: Recompile with -Xlint:deprecation for details.
1 error

[/quote]
sorry but i just have to
LOL[/quote]
Sorry, I just had to…
HE’S BACK!
GUESS WHO BAX? BAX AGAIN, TELL YOU IMAGANERY FRIENX…

Read full topic

item.title: JProgressBars, Can you make them load nothing?
item.dc:creator: @_Java1 † Java †
item.description:
@_Java1 wrote:

yes there in the same directory… actually, what im trying to do is, i have a menubar on my client, now one option is map, and when i click it i want another GUI to appear, so i made another class to hold that GUI, and the GUI is in its main method, so i made it call the main method but…

Frame_Sub1.java:37: main(java.lang.String[]) in mapframe cannot be applied to ()

             mapframe.main();
                     ^
Note: Some input files use or override a deprecated API.
Note: Recompile with -Xlint:deprecation for details.
1 error

Read full topic

item.title: JProgressBars, Can you make them load nothing?
item.dc:creator: @Silver_Lining Silver Lining
item.description:
@Silver_Lining wrote:

I’m pretty sure you’re trying to make a new instance of a class.

Read full topic
item.source: JProgressBars, Can you make them load nothing?

item.title: JProgressBars, Can you make them load nothing?
item.dc:creator: @_Java1 † Java †
item.description:
@_Java1 wrote:

Nah, im just trying to make it run another class at the end… Like, ‘call’ another class to run once one is done.

Read full topic
item.source: JProgressBars, Can you make them load nothing?

item.title: JProgressBars, Can you make them load nothing?
item.dc:creator: @Yz85Racer Yz85Racer
item.description:
@Yz85Racer wrote:

I think he’s trying to call a method from another class, so you would have like;

ClassName.methodName();

But you’d have to have them in the same directory.
If not, use packages.

Read full topic
item.source: JProgressBars, Can you make them load nothing?

item.title: JProgressBars, Can you make them load nothing?
item.dc:creator: @Silver_Lining Silver Lining
item.description:
@Silver_Lining wrote:

If you’re trying to create a new instance of a class, you want “new MYCLASS(args)”

Read full topic

item.title: JProgressBars, Can you make them load nothing?
item.dc:creator: @_Java1 † Java †
item.description:
@_Java1 wrote:

Now how would i call another class after this is done loading?

I tried

MYCLASS.java();

… thought it was a method…

i tried

MYCLASS.java;

nope.

Read full topic

item.title: JProgressBars, Can you make them load nothing?
item.dc:creator: @Silver_Lining Silver Lining
item.description:
@Silver_Lining wrote:

[quote=“Mr.Chris, post:14, topic:120758”]I’m not really any good at Java, but I remember reading about this in my book (Thanks for posting this. I think I might, for a second time, try and learn some Java that will help me in RS cheating :P)[/quote]“SpicedBot” would suck automatically.

Read full topic
item.source: JProgressBars, Can you make them load nothing?

item.title: JProgressBars, Can you make them load nothing?
item.dc:creator: @Mr.Chris Mr.Chris
item.description:
@Mr.Chris wrote:

I’m not really any good at Java, but I remember reading about this in my book (Thanks for posting this. I think I might, for a second time, try and learn some Java that will help me in RS cheating :P)

[code]import java.awt.;
import java.awt.event.;
import javax.swing.*;

public class Progress extends JFrame {

JProgressBar current;
JTextArea out;
JButton find;
Thread runner;
int num = 0;

public Progress() {
	super("Progress");
	setDefaultCloseOperation(JFrame.EXIT_ON_CLOSE);
	setLayout(new FlowLayout());
	current = new JProgressBar(0, 2000);
	current.setValue(0);
	current.setStringPainted(true);
	add(current);
}

public void iterate() {
	while (num < 2000) {
		current.setValue(num);
		try {
			Thread.sleep(1000);
		} catch (InterruptedException e) { }
		num += 95;
	}
}

public static void main(String[] arguments) {
	Progress frame = new Progress();
	frame.pack();
	frame.setVisible(true);
	frame.iterate();
}

}[/code]

I’m not sure if that will help you.

Read full topic
item.source: JProgressBars, Can you make them load nothing?

item.title: JProgressBars, Can you make them load nothing?
item.dc:creator: @joujoujou joujoujou
item.description:
@joujoujou wrote:

k00dr’s code doesn’t deal with safe multi-threading of the worker thread & Swing thread. That’s why I’d rather use Swing timers or Swing workers (linked to a example that updates GUI during a slow operation) depending on the case. For tasks that take long enough to fill a progress bar slowly, the Swing worker sounds fine.

Read full topic
item.source: JProgressBars, Can you make them load nothing?

item.title: JProgressBars, Can you make them load nothing?
item.dc:creator: @dracar dracar
item.description:
@dracar wrote:

At least you can get them to work, i was working on adding one to an app i made becuase it could take awhile if you used #'s higher then like 1000 but i could not get it to update correctly…

Read full topic

item.title: JProgressBars, Can you make them load nothing?
item.dc:creator: @tL tL
item.description:
@tL wrote:

[quote=“Pwnd, post:10, topic:120758”][quote author=Fr33sc4p3 link=topic=170338.msg1577856#msg1577856 date=1183865842]

wont run

Exception in thread "main" java.lang.NoSuchMethodError: main
Press any key to continue . . .

got it, added main(String[] args) {

Maybe because there is no class called main?

[/quote]You fail. It’s a “NoSuchMethod” exception.[/quote]

L2knowwhenimissreadthanks.

item.source: JProgressBars, Can you make them load nothing?

item.title: JProgressBars, Can you make them load nothing?
item.dc:creator: @_Java1 † Java †
item.description:
@_Java1 wrote:

no i fixed it, changed it to this

[code]
import java.awt.Dimension;
import java.awt.FlowLayout;

import java.util.Random;

import javax.swing.JFrame;
import javax.swing.JProgressBar;

public final class Progress extends Thread {

public static void main(String[] args)
{
new Progress();
}

private JFrame frame;

private JProgressBar bar;

public Progress() {

frame = new JFrame("Please wait...");
frame.setDefaultCloseOperation(JFrame.DO_NOTHING_ON_CLOSE);
frame.setResizable(false);

frame.setLayout(new FlowLayout(FlowLayout.CENTER, 25, 25));

bar = new JProgressBar(JProgressBar.HORIZONTAL, 0, 100);
bar.setPreferredSize(new Dimension(200, 20));
bar.setStringPainted(true);
frame.add(bar);

frame.pack();
frame.setVisible(true);

Thread loading = this;
loading.start();

}

public final void run() {

try {

  StringBuilder str = new StringBuilder(4);
  Random rand = new Random();

  for(int value = 0; value <= 100; value++) {

    bar.setValue(value);
    str.append(value);
    str.append('%');
    bar.setString(str.toString());
    str.setLength(0);

    sleep(rand.nextInt(75));
  }

  frame.setTitle("All done!");
  bar.setString("Loading IDE, Please Wait.");
  sleep(1000);

} catch(InterruptedException ex) {
}

frame.dispose();

}

}[/code]

item.source: JProgressBars, Can you make them load nothing?

item.title: JProgressBars, Can you make them load nothing?
item.dc:creator: @k00dr k00dr
item.description:
@k00dr wrote:

Here’s a simple example

import java.awt.Dimension;
import java.awt.FlowLayout;

import java.util.Random;

import javax.swing.JFrame;
import javax.swing.JProgressBar;

public final class Progress extends Thread {

  private JFrame frame;

  private JProgressBar bar;

  public Progress() {

    frame = new JFrame("Please wait...");
    frame.setDefaultCloseOperation(JFrame.DO_NOTHING_ON_CLOSE);
    frame.setResizable(false);

    frame.setLayout(new FlowLayout(FlowLayout.CENTER, 25, 25));

    bar = new JProgressBar(JProgressBar.HORIZONTAL, 0, 100);
    bar.setPreferredSize(new Dimension(640, 200));
    bar.setStringPainted(true);
    frame.add(bar);

    frame.pack();
    frame.setVisible(true);

    Thread loading = this;
    loading.start();

  }

  public final void run() {

    try {

      StringBuilder str = new StringBuilder(4);
      Random rand = new Random();

      for(int value = 0; value <= 100; value++) {

        bar.setValue(value);
        str.append(value);
        str.append('%');
        bar.setString(str.toString());
        str.setLength(0);

        sleep(rand.nextInt(75));
      }

      frame.setTitle("All done!");
      bar.setString("Finished, exiting...");
      sleep(1000);

    } catch(InterruptedException ex) {
    }

    frame.dispose();

  }

}

item.title: JProgressBars, Can you make them load nothing?
item.dc:creator: @Fasga Fasga
item.description:
@Fasga wrote:

The ProgressBar doesn’t actually load anything. Your program should be updating it. So, to answer your question, yes it is possible. Just use Thread’s sleep method or such.

Read full topic
